oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-12-07 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 7, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Cowboy Copas (host/performer), guest performer George Jones (although Johnny Cash was advertised as the guest for this week on the previous show), and regular performers the Jordanaires, Pete Stamper, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 949th broadcast, though in fact it is likely the 948th.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; George Jones; Del Wood; Cowboy Copas; Jordanaires; Tommy Jackson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Cowboy Copas introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert commercial (Cowboy Copas, Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Cowboy Copas introduces George Jones -- A New Baby For Christmas (George Jones) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Del Wood -- Maggie Blues (Del Wood) -- Cowboy Copas talks -- Breeze (Cowboy Copas, Jordanaires) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Tommy Jackson -- Cripple Creek (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Cowboy Copas calls) -- Closing statement (Cowboy Copas) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Station announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Minnie Pearl; Stamper, Pete, 1930-; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jordanaires (Musical group); Jackson, Tommy; Copas, Cowboy; Jones, George, 1931-2013
